ack.title: Acknowledgements
ack.p: This study has been equally funded through an Elevate research grant from the MITACS organization (grant number: IT08453) and through the Fonds Vert du Québec in the framework of the 2013–2020 action plan on climate changes. Plus, A.I.P. was funded by the Fonds de recherche du Québec - Nature et technologies (grant number: 200414), the Concordia Institute for Water, Energy and Sustainable Systems (CIWESS) and the Academy of Finland (grant number: 308365). We thus acknowledge all these organizations for making this work possible. The authors also wish to warmly thank R. Millar and J. Rogelj for providing data of cumulative CO 2 emissions for RCP scenarios, M. Leduc at Ouranos and A. Adam-Poupart at the Institut National de Santé Publique du Québec (INSPQ) for their advice on our work, and B. Gauvin Saint-Denis, T. J. Smith and M. Labassi at Ouranos for their technical help. We finally acknowledge the World Climate Research Programme’s Working Group on Coupled Modelling, which is responsible of the fifth Coupled Model Intercomparison Project, and we thank the climate modelling groups for producing and making available their model output.
